results.title: Azure Cognitive Services modules for Python
results.content:
# Azure Cognitive Services modules for Python
Add image and face recognition, language analysis, and search to your Python apps, websites, and tools using the Azure Cognitive Services modules for Python.
## Vision modules
### Computer Vision
Returns information about visual content found in an image:
1. Use tagging, descriptions, and domain-specific models to identify content and label it with confidence.
2. Apply adult/racy settings to enable automated restriction of adult content.
3. Identify image types and color schemes in pictures.
[Try Computer Vision](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/cognitive-services/computer-vision/) for free in your browser.
Get the Python module with [pip](https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/quickstart/):
```python
pip install azure-cognitiveservices-vision-computervision
```
[Learn more](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/computer-vision/home) about the Computer Vision API and get started with the [Computer Vision API Python quickstart](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/computer-vision/quickstarts/python).
### Content Moderator
Machine-assisted moderation of text, video and images, augmented with human review tools.
Get the Python module with [pip](https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/quickstart/):
```python
pip install azure-cognitiveservices-vision-contentmoderator
```
[Learn more](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/content-moderator/overview) about the Content Moderator service.
### Custom Vision Service
Upload images to train and customize a computer vision model for your specific use case. Once the model is trained, you can use the API to tag images using the model and evaluate the results to improve your classifier.
Get the Python module with [pip](https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/quickstart/):
```python
pip install azure-cognitiveservices-vision-customvision
```
[Learn more](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/Custom-Vision-Service/home) about the Custom Vision service and get started with the [Custom Vision Python tutorial](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/Custom-Vision-Service/python-tutorial)
### Face API
Detect, identify, analyze, organize, and tag faces in photos.
[Try the Face API](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/cognitive-services/face/) in your browser.
Get the Python module with [pip](https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/quickstart/):
```python
pip install cognitive-face
```
[Learn more](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/face/overview) about the Face API and get started with the [Face API Python quickstart](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/Face/Tutorials/FaceAPIinPythonTutorial).

results.title: Choose an Azure AI image and video processing and generation technology
results.content:
# Choose an Azure AI image and video processing and generation technology
## Services
5.2. **Don't use** Video Indexer for basic video analysis tasks like people counting and motion and event detection. The basic video analysis in Vision is more cost-effective for these tasks.
### Azure OpenAI
[Azure OpenAI](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/openai/index) provides access to OpenAI's powerful language models, including the latest generation of [GPT models](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-foundry/foundry-models/concepts/models-sold-directly-by-azure). These models support visual analysis and generation of images. [DALL-E](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-foundry/openai/how-to/dall-e) also supports image generation.
### Vision
[Vision](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/computer-vision/) provides advanced algorithms that process images and return information based on the visual features that you specify. It provides four services: OCR, Azure AI Face, image analysis, and spatial analysis.
#### Capabilities
The following table provides a list of capabilities available in Vision.
| Capability | Description| 
|  --- | ---  |
| [OCR](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/computer-vision/overview-ocr) | OCR extracts text from images. You can use the Read API to extract printed and handwritten text from photos and documents. It uses deep-learning-based models to process text across various surfaces and backgrounds. These materials include business documents, invoices, receipts, posters, business cards, letters, and whiteboards. The OCR APIs support printed text extraction in [several languages](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/computer-vision/language-support). |
| [Vision Image Analysis](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/computer-vision/overview-image-analysis) | Image Analysis extracts many visual features from images, such as objects, faces, and autogenerated text descriptions. You can create custom image identifier models by using [Image Analysis 4.0](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/computer-vision/how-to/model-customization) that's based on the Florence foundation model. |
| [Video Analysis](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/computer-vision/intro-to-spatial-analysis-public-preview) | Video Analysis includes video-related features like Spatial Analysis and Video Retrieval. Spatial Analysis analyzes the presence and movement of people on a video feed and produces events that other systems can respond to. |

### Custom Vision

# Tutorial: Azure Vision in Foundry Tools
[Azure Vision in Foundry Tools](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/computer-vision/) is a [Foundry Tool](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/) that enables you to process images and return information based on the visual features. In this tutorial, you'll learn how to use [Vision](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/computer-vision/) to analyze images on Azure Synapse Analytics.
This tutorial demonstrates using text analytics with [SynapseML](https://github.com/microsoft/SynapseML) to:
1. Extract visual features from the image content
2. Recognize characters from images (OCR)
3. Analyze image content and generate thumbnail
4. Detect and identify domain-specific content in an image
5. Generate tags related to an image
6. Generate a description of an entire image in human-readable language
## Analyze image
Extracts a rich set of visual features based on the image content, such as objects, faces, adult content, and autogenerated text descriptions.
### Example input
![Photograph of a dog.](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/synapse-analytics/machine-learning/media/tutorial-computer-vision-use-mmlspark/dog.jpg)
### Expected results
```json
["dog","outdoor","fence","wooden","small","brown","building","sitting","front","bench","standing","table","walking","board","beach","holding","bridge"]
```

results.title: What is Custom Vision?
results.content:
# What is Custom Vision?
1. The [quickstarts](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/ai-services/custom-vision-service/getting-started-build-a-classifier) are step-by-step instructions that let you make calls to the service and get results in a short period of time.
2. The [how-to guides](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/ai-services/custom-vision-service/test-your-model) contain instructions for using the service in more specific or customized ways.
For a more structured approach, follow a **Training module** for Custom Vision:
1. [Classify images with the Custom Vision service](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/classify-images-custom-vision/)
2. [Classify endangered bird species with Custom Vision](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/cv-classify-bird-species/)
## How it works
The Custom Vision service uses a machine learning algorithm to analyze images for custom features. You submit sets of images that do and don't have the visual characteristics you're looking for. Then you label the images with your own labels (tags) at the time of submission. The algorithm trains to this data and calculates its own accuracy by testing itself on the same images. Once you've trained your model, you can test, retrain, and eventually use it in your image recognition app to [classify images](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/ai-services/custom-vision-service/getting-started-build-a-classifier) or [detect objects](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/ai-services/custom-vision-service/get-started-build-detector). You can also [export the model](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/ai-services/custom-vision-service/export-your-model) for offline use.
### Classification and object detection
Custom Vision functionality can be divided into two features. **[Image classification](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/ai-services/custom-vision-service/getting-started-build-a-classifier)** applies one or more labels to an entire image. **[Object detection](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/ai-services/custom-vision-service/get-started-build-detector)** is similar, but it returns the coordinates in the image where the applied label(s) are found.
### Use case optimization
The Custom Vision service is optimized to quickly recognize major differences between images, so you can start prototyping your model with a small amount of data. It's generally a good start to use 50 images per label. However, the service isn't optimal for detecting subtle differences in images (for example, detecting minor cracks or dents in quality assurance scenarios).
Additionally, you can choose from several variations of the Custom Vision algorithm that are optimized for images with certain subject material—for example, landmarks or retail items. For more information, see [Select a domain](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/ai-services/custom-vision-service/select-domain).

#### Extract information with Azure Content Understanding in Foundry Tools
1. Create an OCR pipeline to extract text from images and documents

4. Unlock the hidden insights in your data with Azure AI Search. In this module, you'll learn how to implement a knowledge mining solution that extracts and enriches data, making it searchable and ready for deeper analysis.

[Perform search reranking with semantic ranking in Azure AI Search](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/use-semantic-search/)

Learn how to perform L2 ranking with semantic ranker in Azure AI Search.

[Perform vector search and retrieval in Azure AI Search](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/improve-search-results-vector-search/)

Learn how to perform vector search and retrieval in Azure AI Search.

results.title: Develop solutions with Azure AI Document Intelligence - Training
results.content:
# Develop solutions with Azure AI Document Intelligence

- Learning Path
- 4 Modules

## At a glance

- Level 

[Intermediate](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?levels=intermediate&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Skill 

 
- Product 

[Azure AI Document Intelligence](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?products=document-intelligence&resource_type=learning%20path)[Azure AI services](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?products=ai-services&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Role 

[AI Engineer](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?roles=ai-engineer&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Subject 

[Artificial intelligence](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?subjects=artificial-intelligence&resource_type=learning%20path)

In this learning path, discover how Azure AI Document Intelligence solutions can enable you to capture data from typed or hand-written forms. Learn how to build a solution for your custom form types and integrate that solution into an Azure Cognitive Search pipeline. You'll learn how to:

- Design a solution that analyzes your business forms by using Azure AI Document Intelligence.
- Create a solution that analyzes common documents by using Document Intelligence.
- Create a solution that analyses different custom form types by using Document Intelligence.
- Include an Azure AI Document Intelligence service as a custom skill in an Azure AI Search pipeline.

## Prerequisites

- None

**Achievement Code**

Would you like to request an achievement code?

## Modules in this learning path

[Plan an Azure AI Document Intelligence solution](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/plan-form-recognizer-solution/)

Learn how to use Azure AI Document Intelligence to build solutions that analyze forms and output data for storage or further processing.

[Use prebuilt Document intelligence models](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/use-prebuilt-form-recognizer-models/)

Learn what data you can analyze by choosing prebuilt Forms Analyzer models and how to deploy these models in a Document intelligence solution.

[Extract data from forms with Azure Document intelligence](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/work-form-recognizer/)

Document intelligence uses machine learning technology to identify and extract key-value pairs and table data from form documents with accuracy, at scale. This module teaches you how to use the *Azure Document intelligence* cognitive service.

[Create a composed Document intelligence model](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/create-composed-form-recognizer-model/)

Learn how to assemble custom models into composed solutions that can analyze different types of your own documents.

results.title: Study guide for Exam AI-102: Designing and Implementing a Microsoft Azure AI Solution
results.content:
# Study guide for Exam AI-102: Designing and Implementing a Microsoft Azure AI Solution
## Skills measured as of December 23, 2025
12. Implement custom translation, including training, improving, and publishing a custom model
### Implement knowledge mining and information extraction solutions (15–20%)
#### Implement an Azure AI Search solution
1. Provision an Azure AI Search resource, create an index, and define a skillset
2. Create data sources and indexers
3. Implement custom skills and include them in a skillset
4. Create and run an indexer
5. Query an index, including syntax, sorting, filtering, and wildcards
6. Manage Knowledge Store projections, including file, object, and table projections
7. Implement semantic and vector store solutions
#### Implement an Azure Document Intelligence in Foundry Tools solution
1. Provision a Document Intelligence resource
2. Use prebuilt models to extract data from documents
3. Implement a custom document intelligence model
4. Train, test, and publish a custom document intelligence model
5. Create a composed document intelligence model
#### Extract information with Azure Content Understanding in Foundry Tools
1. Create an OCR pipeline to extract text from images and documents
2. Summarize, classify, and detect attributes of documents
3. Extract entities, tables, and images from documents
4. Process and ingest documents, images, videos, and audio with Azure Content Understanding in Foundry Tools

contents.text: {"rationale":"Goal: prepare for Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer Associate (Exam AI-102) in 8 weeks at ~6 hrs/week (~48 hrs). Research steps: (1) Pulled the official AI-102 study guide to identify the major skill domains: planning/managing Azure AI solutions; generative AI; agentic solutions; computer vision; NLP; and knowledge mining/information extraction. (2) Queried Microsoft Learn for AI Engineer/AI (intermediate) learning paths that map directly to those domains and that fit within the available time. (3) Selected 3 high-value paths that collectively cover the largest share of AI-102 skills without being overly redundant: Azure AI Services fundamentals for platform setup/security/monitoring/responsible AI; generative AI apps for Foundry + RAG + evaluation/responsible AI; and computer vision solutions for the vision workload portion of the exam.","learningPaths":[{"title":"Get started with Azure AI Services","url":"https://learn.microsoft.com/training/paths/get-started-azure-ai/","estimatedHours":5,"relevance":"Directly supports the AI-102 domain 'Plan and manage an Azure AI solution' by covering provisioning, security, monitoring, container deployment, and responsible AI/content safety for Azure AI services."},{"title":"Develop generative AI apps in Azure","url":"https://learn.microsoft.com/training/paths/create-custom-copilots-ai-studio/","estimatedHours":7,"relevance":"Maps to AI-102 generative AI objectives: working in (Microsoft) Foundry, selecting/deploying models, prompt flow, RAG with your data, fine-tuning, evaluation, and responsible generative AI."},{"title":"Develop computer vision solutions in Azure","url":"https://learn.microsoft.com/training/paths/create-computer-vision-solutions-azure-ai/","estimatedHours":7,"relevance":"Covers the AI-102 computer vision workload: image analysis, OCR/read, face capabilities, custom vision classification/object detection, video analysis, and vision-enabled generative AI patterns."}],"modules":[{"title":"Plan and prepare to develop AI solutions on Azure","url":"https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/prepare-azure-ai-development/","skillFocus":"AI-102 planning fundamentals: choosing Azure AI services/Foundry, tooling/SDKs, and responsible AI considerations."},{"title":"Get started with prompt flow to develop language model apps in the Microsoft Foundry","url":"https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/get-started-prompt-flow-ai-studio/","skillFocus":"AI-102 generative AI: prompt flow concepts and hands-on development workflow."},{"title":"Develop a RAG-based solution with your own data using Microsoft Foundry","url":"https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/build-copilot-ai-studio/","skillFocus":"AI-102 generative AI: implement the RAG pattern by grounding a model in your data (common exam objective)."},{"title":"Use AI responsibly with Microsoft Foundry Content Safety","url":"https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/responsible-content-safety/","skillFocus":"AI-102 responsible AI: content moderation/content safety concepts and practical use."},{"title":"Analyze images","url":"https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/analyze-images/","skillFocus":"AI-102 computer vision: implement image analysis and interpret responses."},{"title":"Read text in images","url":"https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/read-text-images-documents-with-computer-vision-service/","skillFocus":"AI-102 computer vision: OCR (Read API) for printed/handwritten text extraction."}],"targets":[{"title":"Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer Associate (AI-102) study guide","type":"Exam/Study guide","url":"https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-102"},{"title":"Course AI-102T00-A: Develop AI solutions in Azure","type":"Course","url":"https://learn.microsoft.com/training/courses/ai-102t00"}]}
